glsa.title: Perl: Denial of service
glsa.synopsis: A vulnerability in Perl allows a remote attacker to cause Denial of Service.

background.p: Perl is a highly capable, feature-rich programming language.

description.p: S_regmatch() function lacks proper checks before passing arguments to atoi()

impact.p: A remote attacker could send a specially crafted input, possibly resulting in a Denial of Service condition.

workaround.p: There is no known workaround at this time.

resolution.p: All Perl users should upgrade to the latest version:
